German: Wir konnten die Eingabemethode nicht erkennen
Spanish: No hemos podido detectar tu dispositivo de entrada.
Portuguese (Brazil): Não foi possível detectar sua entrada
Chinese (Simplified): 无法检测您的控制输入方式
Chinese (Traditional): 無法偵測您的控制輸入方式
PolskI: Nie udało się wykryć metody wejścia

description: Text that describes an input binding as empty. Eg, no button is bound to the action
Japanese: なし

description: A prompt telling the user to bind a game action to any button they press on the keyboard. Where {0} is replaced with an icon of the escape key.
English: Press any button to set new binding or press {0} to Cancel
Japanese: いずれかのボタンを押して操作方法を割り当てるか、 {0} を押してキャンセルしてください
Russian: Нажмите нужную клавишу, чтобы привязать её, или {0}, чтобы отменить привязку.
French: Appuyez sur une touche pour l'assigner ou appuyez sur {0} pour annuler.
German: Drücke eine beliebige Taste, um die Belegung zu ändern, oder drücke {0}, um abzubrechen
Spanish: Pulsa cualquier botón para establecer una nueva asociación o pulsa {0} para cancelar.
Portuguese (Brazil): Pressione qualquer botão para definir uma nova combinação ou pressione {0} para cancelar
Chinese (Simplified): 按下任一按键设定新绑定，或按下 {0} 取消
Chinese (Traditional): 按下任一按鍵設定新綁定，或按下 {0} 取消
Korean: 아무 버튼을 눌러 새 입력을 설정하거나 {0} 버튼을 눌러 취소합니다
PolskI: Naciśnij dowolny przycisk, aby ustawić nowe przypisanie lub naciśnij {0}, aby anulować

description: A prompt telling the user to press a button to assign it to an action
Japanese: 使うボタンを押してください

description: Action for rebinding a control
Japanese: 再割当

description: Action for unbinding a control from a button
Japanese: 割当解除

description: Header text telling the user to select a difficulty option for the game prior to starting.
Japanese: 難易度を選んでください

description: Body text informing the player they can change the difficulty of the game at any time through the settings menu.
English: Don't worry! You can change the Difficulty at any time in the Settings menu
Japanese: 難易度は設定メニューからいつでも変更が可能です
Russian: Уровень сложности в любое время можно изменить в меню «Настройки».
French: Pas de panique ! Vous pourrez changer la difficulté à tout moment dans les paramètres.
German: Keine Sorge! Du kannst den Schwierigkeitsgrad jederzeit im Einstellungsmenü ändern.
Spanish: ¡No te preocupes! Puedes cambiar la dificultad en cualquier momento en el menú de ajustes.
Portuguese (Brazil): Não se preocupe! Você poderá mudar a Dificuldade durante o jogo pelo menu Configurações.
Chinese (Simplified): 别担心！你随时都能在设定菜单里调整难度
Chinese (Traditional): 別擔心！你隨時都能在設定選單裡變更難度
Korean: 걱정 마세요! 난이도는 언제나 설정 메뉴에서 다시 선택할 수 있습니다
PolskI: Nie martw się! Możesz zmienić poziom trudności w dowolnym momencie w menu ustawień

description: Generic term for describing general items/decorations/etc.
Japanese: 一般

description: Header text describing the content as shorthand for "statistics"
Japanese: データ

description: Header text describing the content as notifications
Japanese: 通知

description: Header text describing the content as ecnomy related
Japanese: 経済

description: Header text describing the content as related to decorations.
Japanese: 装飾品

description: Header text describing the content as related to followers.
Japanese: 信者

description: Text on a tab describing the content of the menu as related to a Follower's name
Japanese: 名前

description: Text on a tab describing the content of the menu as related to the Follower's Form (eg animal race)
Japanese: 種族

description: Text on a tab describing the content of the menu as related to the Follower's appearance (eg colour and variant)
Japanese: 見た目

description: Text on a tab describing the content of the menu as related to the Follower's Traits
Japanese: 特性

description: Text next to a button describing whether the user has enabled a hold actions. This is to turn off the requirement to hold a button down for a certain period of time to interact.
Japanese: 長押し決定

description: Graphics setting related to HDR Brightness
Japanese: 輝度

description: Header describing the player as having no weapon currently equipped. Weapons are found in the game's dungeons.
Japanese: 武器 なし

description: Description for when the player has no weapon currently equipped.
English: You currently have no weapon equipped. Find weapons during a Crusade to equip them.
Japanese: 現在、武器を装備していません。聖戦中に武器を見つけて装備しましょう。
Russian: Вы ещё не получили оружие. Найдите его во время похода.
French: Vous n'avez aucune arme équipée. Vous pouvez en trouver dans les donjons.
German: Du hast derzeit keine Waffe ausgerüstet. Finde Waffen während eines Kreuzzugs, um sie auszurüsten.
Spanish: No has equipado ninguna arma. Busca armas durante las cruzadas para equiparlas.
Portuguese (Brazil): Você não tem nenhuma arma equipada no momento. Encontre armas durante as Cruzadas para equipá-las.
Chinese (Simplified): 你目前并未装备武器，请在进行圣战时寻找可以装备的武器。
Chinese (Traditional): 你目前並未裝備武器，請在進行聖戰時尋找可以裝備的武器。
Korean: 현재 무기를 장비하지 않았습니다. 성전 중에 무기를 찾아 장비하세요.
PolskI: Obecnie nie masz wyposażonej broni. Znajdź bronie podczas Krucjaty, aby je wyposażyć.

description: Header describing the player as having no curse currently equipped. Curses are found in the game's dungeons.
Japanese: 呪い なし

description: Description for when the player has no curse equipped.
English: You currently have no curse equipped. Find Curses during a Crusade to equip them.
Japanese: 現在、呪いを装備していません。聖戦中に武器を見つけて装備しましょう。
Russian: Вы ещё не получили проклятие. Найдите его во время похода.
French: Vous n'avez aucun maléfice équipé. Vous pouvez en trouver dans les donjons.
German: Du hast derzeit keinen Fluch ausgerüstet. Finde Flüche während eines Kreuzzugs, um sie auszurüsten.
Spanish: No has equipado ninguna maldición. Busca maldiciones durante las cruzadas para equiparlas.
Portuguese (Brazil): Você não tem nenhuma maldição equipada no momento. Encontre maldições durante as Cruzadas para equipá-las.
Chinese (Simplified): 你目前并未装备咒术，请在进行圣战时寻找可以装备的咒术。
Chinese (Traditional): 你目前並未裝備咒術，請在進行聖戰時尋找可以裝備的咒術。
Korean: 현재 저주를 장비하지 않았습니다. 성전 중에 저주를 찾아 장비하세요.
PolskI: Obecnie nie masz wyposażonej klątwy. Znajdź klątwy podczas Krucjaty, aby je wyposażyć.

description: Header describing the player has not unlocked a crown ability.
Japanese: 王冠の権能 未開放

description: Description for when the player has not unlocked a crown ability, and prompting them to return to the Lonely Shack to unlock more.
English: Return to the Lonely Shack to unlock new Crown Abilities to help you on your Crusades.
Japanese: 隠れ小屋に戻って、聖戦を助けてくれる王冠の権能をアンロックしましょう。
Russian: Чтобы открыть способности короны, подойдите к алтарю у одинокой хижины.
French: Rendez-vous à la Cabane solitaire pour débloquer de nouveaux Pouvoirs de la Couronne à utiliser dans les donjons.
German: Kehre zur Einsamen Hütte zurück, um neue Kronenfähigkeiten freizuschalten, die dir auf deinen Kreuzzügen helfen.
Spanish: Vuelve a la cabaña solitaria para desbloquear nuevos poderes de la corona que te ayudarán en tus cruzadas.
Portuguese (Brazil): Volte para o Barraco Solitário para desbloquear novas Habilidades da Coroa que te ajudarão durante as Cruzadas.
Chinese (Simplified): 请返回偏僻小屋解锁有利你进行圣战的新圣冠能力。
Chinese (Traditional): 請返回偏僻小屋解鎖有利你進行聖戰的新聖冠能力。
Korean: 외로운 판잣집으로 돌아가 성전에 도움이 될 새 왕관 능력을 해금하세요.
PolskI: Wróć do samotnej chaty, aby odblokować nowe zdolności Korony, które pomogą ci podczas Krucjat.

description: Header describing an entry on the player menu displaying how many shards of a holy talisman you have.
Japanese: 聖なる魔除けのかけら

description: Description for holy talisman pieces and how many the player has, as well as a prompt for them to go out and find more. Where {0} is how many pieces they have and {1} is the total number of pieces to complete a Talisman.
English: You currently have {0} of {1} Holy Talisman Pieces. Find more throughout your adventures to find a full Holy Talisman.
Japanese: 現在、聖なる魔除けのかけらを {0} 個所有しています。 {1} 個集めて、聖なる魔除けを完成させましょう。
Russian: У вас {0} из {1} осколков священного талисмана. Ищите их в землях древней веры.
French: Vous possédez {0}/{1} éclats de talisman. Trouvez tous les éclats pour assembler un talisman sacré.
German: Du hast derzeit {0} von {1} Heiliger-Talisman-Stücken. Finde während deiner Abenteuer mehr davon, um einen vollständigen Heiligen Talisman zu erhalten.
Spanish: Tienes {0} fragmentos de talismán sagrado de {1}. Busca más en tus aventuras para completarlo.
Portuguese (Brazil): No momento você tem {0} de {1} Pedaços de Talismã. Encontre mais pedaços durante suas aventuras para formar um Talismã Sagrado.
Chinese (Simplified): 你目前有 {0}/{1} 块神圣护身符碎片。冒险时找到更多碎片即可拼成一个完整的神圣护身符。
Chinese (Traditional): 你目前有 {0} 塊 / {1} 塊神聖護身符碎片。冒險時找到更多碎片即可拚成一個完整的神聖護身符。
Korean: 현재 {1}개의 성스러운 부적 조각 중 {0}개를 발견했습니다. 모험에서 더 많은 조각을 발견해 성스러운 부적을 완성하세요.
PolskI: Obecnie masz {0} z {1} fragmentów świętego talizmanu. Znajdź więcej podczas swoich przygód, aby zdobyć pełny święty talizman.

description:
Setting
  Controls the level of vibrations on controlller
Japanese: ゲームパッド振動強度

description: Title for a popup window that appears when there is an issue saving the game
Japanese: セーブエラー

description: The description for a popup window that describes an error when trying to save the game
English: An error occurred while saving your game. If you continue your progress may be lost.
Japanese: セーブ中にエラーが発生しました。このまま続けると進行度が失われる可能性があります。
Russian: При сохранении произошла ошибка. Если вы выйдете из игры, ваш прогресс может быть потерян.
French: Erreur lors de la sauvegarde. Si vous continuez, vous risquez de perdre votre progression.
German: Fehler beim Speichern des Spiels. Dein Fortschritt kann verlorengehen, wenn du den Vorgang fortsetzt.
Spanish: Se ha producido un error al guardar la partida. Si continuas, podrías perder tu progreso.
Portuguese (Brazil): Um erro aconteceu enquanto seu jogo era salvo. Se você continuar, poderá perder o seu progresso.
Chinese (Simplified): 储存游戏时发生错误。如果继续，您的游戏进度可能遗失。
Chinese (Traditional): 儲存遊戲時發生錯誤。如果繼續，您的遊戲進度可能遺失。
Korean: 게임을 저장하는 중에 에러가 발생했습니다. 계속 진행하면 진행 과정이 사라질 수 있습니다.
PolskI: Wystąpił błąd podczas zapisywania gry. Jeśli kontynuujesz, możesz utracić postępy.

description: A button prompt telling the user they can retry saving the game
Japanese: 再試行

description: When you recruit a new follower you can 'customize' how they look.
Japanese: <color=#FFD201>カスタマイズ</color>

description: Description for when the player has not unlocked a crown ability, and prompting them to return to the Lonely Shack to unlock more.
English: Use Heretic Hearts at your Temple to unlock new Crown Abilities to help you on your Crusades.
Japanese: 教会堂にて異端者の心臓を使い、聖戦を助けてくれる王冠の権能をアンロックしましょう。
Russian: Насыщайте корону сердцами еретиков в храме, чтобы открывать способности короны.
French: Utilisez des cœurs d'hérétiques pour débloquer de nouveaux Pouvoirs de la Couronne à utiliser dans les donjons.
German: Verwende Ketzerherzen in deinem Tempel, um neue Kronenfähigkeiten freizuschalten, die dir auf deinen Kreuzzügen helfen.
Spanish: Usa los corazones de los herejes de tu templo para desbloquear nuevos poderes de la corona, que te ayudarán en tus cruzadas.
Portuguese (Brazil): Use Corações Hereges no seu Templo para desbloquear novas Habilidades da Coroa que te ajudarão durante as Cruzadas.
Chinese (Simplified): 请前往圣殿使用异教徒之心，解锁有利你进行圣战的新圣冠能力。
Chinese (Traditional): 請前往聖殿使用異教徒之心，解鎖有利你進行聖戰的新聖冠能力。
Korean: 사원에서 이단의 심장을 사용해 새로운 왕관 능력을 해금하고 성전에 도움이 되도록 하세요.
PolskI: Użyj serc heretyków w swojej świątyni, aby odblokować nowe zdolności Korony, które pomogą ci podczas Krucjat.

description: This is an options in the settings menu to reduce the hand held 'wobble' of the camera
Japanese: カメラ揺れ軽減

description:
HUD 
  Used on the menu and in HUD to display what day it is
Japanese: {0}日目

description: Title category for displaying path decorations
Japanese: 地面

description: An action for when you can pick berries or pumpkins or other fruits/vegetables. After the word "Pick" we will show an icon for the thing that they will pick
Japanese: 採集する

description: When a player tries to quit, this warning will appear reminding them they will lose progress since their last save
English: Are you sure you wish to quit? All progress since your last save will be lost.
Japanese: 本当にやめますか？ セーブされていない進行度は失われます。
Russian: Хотите выйти из игры? Весь несохранённый прогресс будет потерян.
French: Voulez-vous vraiment quitter ? La progression depuis votre dernière sauvegarde sera perdue.
German: Möchtest du das Spiel wirklich verlassen? Jeglicher Fortschritt seit deinem letzten Speichervorgang geht verloren.
Spanish: ¿Seguro que quieres salir? Todo el progreso que no hayas guardado se perderá.
Portuguese (Brazil): Tem certeza de que deseja sair? Todo o progresso desde seu último jogo salvo será perdido.
Chinese (Simplified): 确定退出游戏吗？上一次保存进度之后的所有内容都将丢失。
Chinese (Traditional): 確定退出遊戲嗎？上一次存檔之後的所有進度都將遺失。
Korean: 정말로 종료하시겠습니까? 마지막 저장 지점 이후로 진행한 과정을 모두 잃을 것입니다.
PolskI: Czy na pewno chcesz wyjść? Wszystkie postępy od ostatniego zapisu zostaną utracone.

description: Header for the Building section of the controls menu
Japanese: 建築中

description: Header for the Gameplay section of the controls
Japanese: ゲームプレイ

description: Header of the User Interface section of the controls
Japanese: ユーザーインターフェース

description: Keybind for building a structure
Japanese: 建築物を作る

description: Keybind for flipping a structure
Japanese: 建築物の反転

description: Keybind for destroying a structure
Japanese: 建築物の撤去

description: Keybind for Forward player movement
Japanese: 移動 前

description: Keybind for Backward player movement
Japanese: 移動 後ろ

description: Keybind for Left player movement
Japanese: 移動 左

description: Keybind for Right player movement
Japanese: 移動 右

description: Keybind for UI navigation up
Japanese: 操作 上

description: Keybind for UI navigation up
Japanese: 操作 下

description: Keybind for UI navigation left
Japanese: 操作 左

description: Keybind for UI navigation right
Japanese: 操作 右

description: Describes the target framerate as having no cap and therefore is unlimited
Japanese: 無制限

description: A gameplay setting that adjusts the difficulty for the user on the fly
Japanese: アシストモード

description: A description for the gameplay setting that adjusts the difficulty for the user on the fly
English: Assist Mode will tweak the difficulty as the player experiences the game to better tailor a fair and fun experience.
Japanese: アシストモードを有効化すると、プレイヤーがより平等に楽しく遊べるよう、難易度が自動的に調節されます。
Russian: В режиме помощи сложность игры изменяется в зависимости от действий игрока, что делает игровой процесс честнее и увлекательнее.
French: Ce mode ajuste la difficulté au fur et à mesure que le joueur découvre le jeu, afin de lui offrir une expérience accessible et amusante.
German: Der Hilfsmodus passt den Schwierigkeitsgrad an den Spielverlauf an, um dem Spieler ein faires und unterhaltsames Erlebnis zu bieten.
Spanish: El modo Ayuda ajustará la dificultad a medida que vayas jugando para que se adapte a tu ritmo y ofrecerte una mejor experiencia.
Portuguese (Brazil): O Modo de Assistência faz pequenos ajustes à dificuldade, possibilitando que o jogador aproveite o jogo de forma mais equilibrada e divertida.
Chinese (Simplified): 辅助模式会随着玩家体验游戏调整难度，呈现更平衡有趣的游戏体验。
Chinese (Traditional): 輔助模式會隨著玩家體驗遊戲調整難度，呈現更平衡有趣的遊戲體驗。
Korean: 지원 모드는 플레이어의 경험에 따라 난이도를 조절하여 보다 공정하고 재밌는 경험을 제공합니다.
PolskI: Tryb pomocy będzie dostosowywał poziom trudności podczas gry, aby zapewnić sprawiedliwe i przyjemne doświadczenie.

description: A setting that turns off all flashing light effects in the game to assists players with epilepsy
Japanese: フラッシュ

description: A setting that changes fonts in the game to use fonts more friendly to individuals who have dyslexia
Japanese: 失読症患者向けフォント（英語のみ）

description: A setting that defines the type of control prompts displayed for the user so they can change it to whatever input type they like
Japanese: ボタン表示タイプ

description: Auto means control prompt style is handled automatically based on your input device
Japanese: 自動

description: Xbox means the control prompts will display Xbox button prompts
Japanese: Xbox

description: Playstation means the control prompts will display Playstation button prompts
Japanese: PlayStation

description: Nintendo Switch means the control prompts will display Nintendo Switch button prompts
Japanese: Nintendo Switch

description: Changes the dithering fade distance on objects close to the camera
Japanese: ディザリングフェード距離

description: A setting that turns off colours in text fields for easier readability
Japanese: テキスト効果

description: A header field describing the content of a UI element as relating to the in-game Doctrine Fragments
Japanese: 戒律石のかけら

description: Describes to the user the number of doctrine fragments they currently own relative to the number of doctrine fragments they need to create a full stone, which is then used to upgrade the player character.
English: You currently have {0} of {1} Commandment Stone Fragment. Find more throughout your crusades to find a full Doctrine Stone.
Japanese: 現在、戒律石のかけらを {0} 個所有しています。合計 {1} 個集めて、戒律石を完成させましょう。
Russian: У вас {0} из {1} осколков скрижали. Ищите их во время походов, чтобы провозглашать заповеди.
French: Vous possédez {0}/{1} fragments de pierre de commandement. Trouvez d'autres fragments dans les donjons pour assembler une pierre de commandement.
German: Du hast derzeit {0} von {1} Gebotsstein-Fragmenten. Finde während deiner Kreuzzüge mehr davon, um einen vollständigen Gebotsstein zu erhalten.
Spanish: Tienes {0} fragmentos de piedra doctrinal de {1}. Busca más fragmentos durante tus cruzadas para formar una completa.
Portuguese (Brazil): No momento você tem {0} de {1} Fragmentos de Pedra da Doutrina. Encontre mais pedaços durante suas cruzadas para formar uma Pedra da Doutrina.
Chinese (Simplified): 你目前有 {0} / {1} 块教条石碎块。在圣战期间找到更多碎块即可拼成一块完整的教条石。
Chinese (Traditional): 你目前有 {0} / {1} 塊教條石碎塊。在聖戰期間找到更多碎塊即可拚成一塊完整的教條石。
Korean: 현재 {1}개의 계명석 조각 중 {0}개를 발견했습니다. 모험에서 더 많은 조각을 발견해 계명석을 완성하세요.
PolskI: Obecnie masz {0} z {1} fragmentów Kamienia Przykazań. Znajdź więcej podczas swoich krucjat, aby zdobyć pełny Kamień Doktryny.

description: Description for the Sermon category on the game's Altar Menu
English: Perform a sermon, drawing energy from your followers to bolster the power of the Red Crown
Japanese: 説教を行い、信者から力を吸収して赤き王冠の糧にする
Russian: Читайте проповеди и передавайте алой короне силу своих последователей.
French: Prononcez des sermons pour vous nourrir de l'énergie de vos adeptes et renforcer le pouvoir de la Couronne rouge.
German: Halte eine Predigt und entziehe deinen Anhängern Energie, um die Macht der Roten Krone zu stärken.
Spanish: Da un sermón para absorber la energía de tus adeptos y fortalecer el poder de la Corona Roja.
Portuguese (Brazil): Pregue um sermão extraindo a energia dos seus seguidores para reforçar o poder da Coroa Vermelha.
Chinese (Simplified): 对教徒布道，汲取徒众的能量后壮大红眼冠之力
Chinese (Traditional): 對教徒講道，汲取徒眾的能量後壯大紅眼冠之力
Korean: 설교를 하고, 추종자들의 에너지를 모아 붉은 왕관의 힘을 강화하세요
PolskI: Wygłoś kazanie, czerpiąc energię od swoich wyznawców, aby wzmocnić moc Czerwonej Korony

description: Description for the Rituals category on the game's Altar Menu
English: Increase faith and perform dark rituals to manipulate your Cult
Japanese: 信者の信仰心を高め、教団を意のままに操るための闇の儀式を行う
Russian: Укрепляйте веру своих последователей и проводите ритуалы.
French: Réalisez des rituels pour influencer les adeptes de votre culte et gagner plus de foi.
German: Erhöhe den Glauben und führe dunkle Rituale durch, um deinen Kult zu beeinflussen.
Spanish: Aumenta la fe de tus adeptos y celebra rituales oscuros para manipularlos.
Portuguese (Brazil): Aumente a fé e realize rituais para manipular o seu Culto.
Chinese (Simplified): 增加信仰值及举行黑暗仪式以掌控教会
Chinese (Traditional): 增加信仰值及舉行黑暗儀式以掌控教會
Korean: 신앙을 증가시키고 어둠의 의식을 거행해 교단을 조종하세요
PolskI: Zwiększaj wiarę i wykonuj mroczne rytuały, aby manipulować swoim Kultem

description: Description for the Crown category on the game's Altar Menu
English: Upgrade and expand the abilities of the Red Crown
Japanese: 赤き王冠の権能を開放・強化する
Russian: Улучшайте алую корону и расширяйте её возможности.
French: Améliorez et débloquez de nouveaux Pouvoirs de la Couronne.
German: Verbessere und erweitere die Fähigkeiten der Roten Krone.
Spanish: Aumenta y expande las habilidades de la Corona Roja.
Portuguese (Brazil): Aprimore e expanda as habilidades da Coroa Vermelha.
Chinese (Simplified): 升级及拓展红眼冠的能力
Chinese (Traditional): 升級及拓展紅眼冠的能力
PolskI: Ulepszaj i rozwijaj zdolności Czerwonej Korony

description: Description for the Doctrine category on the game's Altar Menu
English: Open your Holy Doctrine to the Commandments you've preached
Japanese: 聖なる戒律書を開き、布告済みの教条を確認する
Russian: Читайте книгу, в которой собраны провозглашённые вами заповеди.
French: Choisissez une doctrine en accord avec les commandements que vous prêchez.
German: Öffne deine heilige Doktrin und sieh dir die Gebote an, die du gepredigt hast.
Spanish: Abre la Doctrina Sagrada para ver los mandamientos que has establecido.
Portuguese (Brazil): Abra a sua Doutrina Sagrada para ver os Mandamentos que você pregou
Chinese (Simplified): 开启神圣教条，检视你宣扬过的戒律
Chinese (Traditional): 開啟神聖教條，檢視你宣揚過的戒律
Korean: 설교한 계명에 대해 신성한 교리를 전파합니다
PolskI: Otwórz swoją Świętą Doktrynę na Przykazania, które głosiłeś

description: Informs the player that a particular building they are selecting has already been built
Japanese: 既に建築済

description: A statistical value to display to the user how long they've played the game for
Japanese: プレイ時間

description: Relates to teaching the player to hold to aim there curses
Japanese: 長押しでエイム

description: Used to show the current version of the game
Japanese: バージョン

description: Shown when the game is being saved
Japanese: セーブ中…

description: Shown under the medium difficulty setting, saying this is the difficulty we recommend for players
Japanese: 開発者オススメ

description:
End Dungeon Screen
  Penalty for winning without taking any damage
English: No damage from boss bonus. <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color> on new items
Japanese: ノーダメージボス撃破ボーナス。見つけたアイテムが<color=#01D5A2>+20%</color>
Russian: Вы не получили урона от босса (<color=#01D5A2>+20%</color> предметов).
French: Aucun dégât de boss subi. Nouveaux objets <color=#01D5A2>+20 %</color>.
German: Bonus: Kein Schaden vom Boss. <color=#01D5A2>+20 %</color> auf neue Gegenstände.
Spanish: Bonus por 0 daño del jefe. <color=#01D5A2>+20 %</color> en nuevos objetos.
Portuguese (Brazil): Bônus: sem dano de chefe. <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color> em novos itens
Chinese (Simplified): 无伤通关头目获得奖励。新物品 <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color>
Chinese (Traditional): 無傷通關頭目獲得獎勵。新物品 <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color>
Korean: 보스로부터 피해 입지 않음 보너스. 새 물품에 <color=#701D5A2>+20%</color>
PolskI: Brak bonusu do obrażeń od bossa. <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color> na nowe przedmioty

description:
End Dungeon Screen
  Penalty for winning without taking any damage
English: No damage from Bishop bonus. <color=#01D5A2>+30%</color> on new items.
Japanese: ノーダメージ司教撃破ボーナス。見つけたアイテムが<color=#01D5A2>+30%</color>
Russian: Вы не получили урона от епископа (<color=#01D5A2>+30%</color> предметов).
French: Aucun dégât des Prélats subi. Nouveaux objets <color=#01D5A2>+30 %</color>.
German: Bonus: Kein Schaden vom Bischof. <color=#01D5A2>+30 %</color> auf neue Gegenstände.
Spanish: Bonus por 0 daño del obispo. <color=#01D5A2>+30 %</color> en nuevos objetos.
Portuguese (Brazil): Bônus: sem dano de Líder. <color=#01D5A2>+30%</color> em novos itens
Chinese (Simplified): 无伤通关邪教领袖获得奖励。新物品 <color=#01D5A2>+30%</color>
Chinese (Traditional): 無傷通關邪教領袖獲得獎勵。新物品 <color=#01D5A2>+30%</color>
Korean: 주교로부터 피해 입지 않음 보너스. 새 물품에 <color=#01D5A2>+30%</color>
PolskI: Brak bonusu do obrażeń od biskupa. <color=#01D5A2>+30%</color> na nowe przedmioty.

description:
End Dungeon Screen
  Penalty for winning without taking any damage
English: Defeated Bishop bonus. <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color> on new items.
Japanese: 司教撃破ボーナス。見つけたアイテムが<color=#01D5A2>+20%</color>
German: Bonus: Zerstörter Kultanführer. <color=#01D5A2>+20 %</color> auf neue Gegenstände.
Spanish: Bonus por destruir al obispo. <color=#01D5A2>+20 %</color> en nuevos objetos.
Portuguese (Brazil): Bônus: Líder destruído. <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color> em novos itens
Chinese (Simplified): 消灭邪教领袖获得奖励。新物品 <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color>
Chinese (Traditional): 消滅邪教領袖獲得獎勵。新物品 <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color>
Korean: 교단 지도자 파괴 보너스. 새 물품에 <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color>
PolskI: Bonus za pokonanie biskupa. <color=#01D5A2>+20%</color> na nowe przedmioty.

description:
End Dungeon Screen
  Penalty for praying at a crown shrine keep all your resources
English: Prayed at Red crown shrine. Keep <color=#01D5A2>100%</color> of new items
Japanese: 赤き王冠の祭壇への祈りが聞き届けられた。見つけたアイテムの<color=#01D5A2>100%</color>を保持
Russian: Вы помолились у алтаря (<color=#01D5A2>100%</color> предметов сохранено).
French: Prière à l'Autel de la Couronne rouge. Vous avez conservé <color=#01D5A2>100 %</color> des nouveaux objets.
German: Am Rote-Krone-Schrein gebetet. Behalte <color=#01D5A2>100 %</color> der neuen Gegenstände.
Spanish: Has rezado en el santuario de la Corona Roja. Te quedas el <color=#01D5A2>100 %</color> de los objetos nuevos.
Portuguese (Brazil): Rezou no santuário da Coroa. <color=#01D5A2>100%</color> de novos itens
Chinese (Simplified): 在红眼冠圣坛完成祈祷。保留 <color=#01D5A2>100%</color> 的新物品
Chinese (Traditional): 在紅眼冠聖壇完成祈禱。保留 <color=#01D5A2>100%</color> 的新物品
Korean: 붉은 왕관 성지에서 기도함. 새 물품 <color=#01D5A2>100%</color> 유지
PolskI: Modlitwa przy sanktuarium Czerwonej Korony. Zachowaj <color=#01D5A2>100%</color> nowych przedmiotów

description: Title for info telling the player their followers are starving
Japanese: 食料が不足している

description: Description for the player's followers not getting enough food. {0} is replaced by the number of hungry followers and {1} is replaced with the total number of followers.
English: Your followers are starving. {0} of {1} followers are not getting enough food!
Japanese: 信者が腹を空かせている。 {1} 人中 {0} 人の信者が満足に食事を取れていない！
Russian: В поселении начался голод. Еды не хватает {0} из {1} ваших последователей.
French: Vos adeptes meurent de faim. {0}/{1} adeptes n'ont pas de quoi manger !
German: Deine Anhänger hungern. {0} von {1} Anhängern erhalten nicht genug Nahrung!
Spanish: Tus adeptos se mueren de hambre. ¡{0} de tus {1} adeptos no están recibiendo suficiente comida!
Portuguese (Brazil): Seus seguidores estão morrendo de fome. {0} de {1} seguidores não estão recebendo comida suficiente!
Chinese (Simplified): 你的徒众正在挨饿。{0} / {1} 位教徒食物不足！
Chinese (Traditional): 你的徒眾正在挨餓。{0} / {1} 位教徒食物不足！
Korean: 추종자들이 굶주리고 있습니다. 추종자 {1}명 중 {0}명이 충분한 음식을 받지 못하고 있습니다!

description: Title for info telling the player there are not enough beds for their followers

description: Description for the player's followers not having enough beds. {0} is replaced by the number of homesless followers and {1} is replaced with the total number of followers.
English: There are not enough beds for your followers. {0} of {1} followers are homeless!
Japanese: 信者のためのベッドが不足している。 {1} 人中 {0} 人の信者の寝床がない！
Russian: В поселении негде жить. Кроватей не хватает {0} из {1} ваших последователей.
French: Il n'y a pas assez de lits pour tous vos adeptes. {0}/{1} adeptes doivent dormir par terre !
German: Es gibt nicht genug Betten für alle deine Anhänger. {0} von {1} Anhängern sind obdachlos!
Spanish: No hay camas suficientes para todos tus adeptos. ¡{0} de tus {1} adeptos se sienten unos vagabundos!
Portuguese (Brazil): Não há camas suficientes para todos os seus seguidores. {0} de {1} seguidores estão desabrigados!
Chinese (Simplified): 你的徒众床数不足。{0} / {1} 位教徒无家可归！
Chinese (Traditional): 你的徒眾床數不足。{0} / {1} 位教徒無家可歸！
Korean: 추종자들에게 침대가 부족합니다. 추종자 {1}명 중 {0}명이 노숙자입니다!
PolskI: Brakuje łóżek dla twoich wyznawców. {0} z {1} wyznawców jest bezdomnych!

description: Title for info telling the player their followers are getting sick
Japanese: 病気が流行している

description: Description for the player's followers getting sick. {0} is replaced by the number of sick followers and {1} is replaced with the total number of followers.
English: Your followers are getting sick. {0} of {1} followers are ill!
Japanese: 信者の間で病気が流行している。 {1} 人中 {0} 人の信者が病気にかかっている！
Russian: В поселении начался мор. Болезнь поразила {0} из {1} ваших последователей.
French: Vos adeptes tombent malades. {0}/{1} adeptes sont souffrants !
German: Deine Anhänger erkranken. {0} von {1} Anhängern sind krank!
Spanish: Tus adeptos están enfermando. ¡{0} de tus {1} adeptos están enfermos!
Portuguese (Brazil): Seus seguidores estão ficando doentes. {0} de {1} seguidores estão doentes!
Chinese (Simplified): 你的徒众染病了。{0} / {1} 位教徒生病了！
Chinese (Traditional): 你的徒眾染病了。{0} / {1} 位教徒生病了！
Korean: 추종자들이 병에 들고 있습니다. 추종자 {1}명 중 {0}명이 아픕니다!
PolskI: Twoi wyznawcy chorują. {0} z {1} wyznawców jest chorych!

description: Title for info telling the player their followers aren't getting enough rest
Japanese: 休憩が足りない

description: Description for the player's followers becoming exhausted. {0} is replaced by the number of exhausted followers and {1} is replaced with the total number of followers.
English: Your followers are getting tired. {0} of {1} followers are exhausted!
Japanese: 信者たちが疲れを訴えている。 {1} 人中 {0} 人の信者が疲労状態だ！
Russian: В поселении слишком много работают. Усталость мучает {0} из {1} ваших последователей.
French: Vos adeptes manquent de sommeil. {0}/{1} adeptes sont épuisés !
German: Deine Anhänger werden müde. {0} von {1} Anhängern sind erschöpft!
Spanish: Tus adeptos están cansados. ¡{0} de tus {1} adeptos no pueden más!
Portuguese (Brazil): Seus seguidores estão ficando cansados. {0} de {1} seguidores estão exaustos!
Chinese (Simplified): 你的徒众感到疲劳。{0} / {1} 位教徒感到疲惫！
Chinese (Traditional): 你的徒眾感到疲累。{0} / {1} 位教徒感到疲憊！

PolskI: Twoi wyznawcy są zmęczeni. {0} z {1} wyznawców jest wyczerpanych!

description: Informs the player they can add a currently selected item to the refinery item queue
Japanese: キューに追加

description: Informs the player they can remove the currently selected item from the refinery item queue

description: Informs the player the current refinery item queue is full
Japanese: キューがいっぱい

description: Informs the player the queue is currently empty
English: The <color=yellow>Resources Queue</color> is empty! Add items for a follower to begin consecrating resources.
Japanese: <color=yellow>資源キュー</color>が空っぽです！ 信者が聖別するためのアイテムを追加しましょう。
Russian: Нет <color=yellow>материалов</color>. Чтобы последователь освятил предметы, их нужно поместить в святилище.
French: La <color=yellow>liste des ressources en attente</color> est vide ! Remplissez-la pour qu'un adepte crée des ressources sacrées.
German: Die <color=yellow>Ressourcen-Warteschlange</color> ist leer! Füge Gegenstände hinzu, damit ein Anhänger damit beginnt, Ressourcen zu weihen.
Spanish: ¡La <color=yellow>cola de recursos</color> está vacía! Añade objetos para que un adepto empiece a consagrarlos.
Portuguese (Brazil): A <color=yellow>Fila de Recursos</color> está vazia! Adicione itens para que um seguidor comece a consagrar recursos.
Chinese (Simplified): <color=yellow>资源序列</color>空了！请新增物品，让教徒开始圣化资源。
Chinese (Traditional): <color=yellow>資源序列</color>空了！請新增物品，讓教徒開始聖化資源。
Korean: <color=yellow>자원 대기열</color>이 비어있습니다! 추종자를 위해 물품을 추가해 자원 변환을 시작하세요.
PolskI: <color=yellow>Kolejka zasobów</color> jest pusta! Dodaj przedmioty dla wyznawcy, aby rozpocząć konsekrację zasobów.

description: if you get two of the same dice they will get mulptiplied i.e 2 & 2 = 4, 2 & 2 & 2 = 8
English: When dice of the same number are placed in the same column, multiply their value.
Japanese: 同値のサイコロが同じ列に配置された場合、その数値は2倍になる
Russian: Если в столбец попадают одинаковые кости, их сумма умножается на количество.
French: Lorsque des dés portant le même numéro sont placés sur la même ligne, leur valeur est multipliée.
German: Werden Würfel mit der gleichen Zahl in derselben Reihe platziert, dann multipliziere ihre Werte.
Spanish: Si sale el mismo número en dos dados consecutivos, multiplica su valor.
Portuguese (Brazil): Quando dados com o mesmo número são posicionados na mesma sequência, multiplique o valor
Chinese (Simplified): 将点数相同的骰子放在同一排时，点数相乘
Chinese (Traditional): 將點數相同的骰子放在同一排時，點數相乘
Korean: 주사위의 눈이 같은 열에 같은 값으로 나올 경우, 그 값을 곱합니다.
PolskI: Gdy kości o tej samej liczbie zostaną położone w tej samej kolumnie, pomnóż ich wartość.

description: How to win knucklebones
English: Your score is calculated by adding all your dice together.
Japanese: サイコロの目の合計がプレイヤーのスコアになる
Russian: Результат представляет собой сумму всех костей.
French: Votre score est égal à la somme de vos dés.
German: Deine Punktzahl errechnet sich aus der Addition aller Würfel.
Spanish: Tu puntuación es la suma del valor de todos los dados.
Portuguese (Brazil): Sua pontuação é calculada pela soma de todos os seus dados.
Chinese (Simplified): 计算分数的方式是加总所有骰子点数。
Chinese (Traditional): 計算分數的方式是加總所有骰子點數。
Korean: 모든 주사위 값을 더해 점수가 계산되었습니다.
PolskI: Twój wynik jest obliczany przez zsumowanie wszystkich twoich kości.

description: Difficulty description when starting a new game - Easy
English: Recommended for casual players looking for a fun, accessible experience.
Japanese: 気楽に遊びたいカジュアルプレイヤー向けの難易度
Russian: Рекомендована тем, кто хочет отдохнуть в игре.
French: Pour les joueurs occasionnels qui cherchent une expérience amusante et accessible.
German: Für Gelegenheitsspieler, die Spaß und ein zugängliches Spielerlebnis suchen.
Spanish: Para jugadores ocasionales que buscan experiencias accesibles.
Portuguese (Brazil): Recomendado a quem quer uma experiência divertida e acessível.
Chinese (Simplified): 推荐给追求轻松、趣味体验的休闲玩家。
Chinese (Traditional): 推薦給追求放鬆、趣味體驗的休閒玩家。
Korean: 재밌고 간단한 경험을 원하는 캐쥬얼한 플레이어를 위해 추천하는 난이도.
PolskI: Zalecane dla casualowych graczy szukających zabawy i łatwego dostępu.

description: Difficulty description when starting a new game - Medium
English: Recommended for moderate players looking for a well rounded experience.
Japanese: それなりの歯ごたえを求める平均的なプレイヤー向けの難易度
Russian: Рекомендована тем, кто во всём ценит баланс.
French: Pour les joueurs réguliers qui cherchent une expérience complète et équilibrée.
German: Für durchschnittliche Spieler, die ein ausgewogenes Erlebnis suchen.
Spanish: Para jugadores de nivel moderado que buscan una experiencia positiva.
Portuguese (Brazil): Recomendado a jogadores moderados para uma experiência equilibrada.
Chinese (Simplified): 推荐给追求均衡体验的一般玩家。
Chinese (Traditional): 推薦給追求均衡體驗的一般玩家。
Korean: 여러가지 경험을 원하는 평범한 플레이어를 위해 추천하는 난이도.
PolskI: Zalecane dla średniozaawansowanych graczy szukających zrównoważonego doświadczenia.

description: Difficulty description when starting a new game - Hard
English: Recommended for experienced players looking for a challenge.
Japanese: やりがいを求めるアクションゲームが得意なプレイヤー向けの難易度
Russian: Рекомендована тем, кто стремится испытать себя.
French: Pour les joueurs expérimentés qui cherchent à relever un défi.
German: Für erfahrene Spieler, die eine Herausforderung suchen.
Spanish: Para jugadores expertos que buscan un reto.
Portuguese (Brazil): Recomendado a jogadores experientes querendo um desafio.
Chinese (Simplified): 推荐给追求挑战的老练玩家。
Chinese (Traditional): 推薦給追求挑戰的老練玩家。
Korean: 도전을 찾아헤매는 숙련된 플레이어를 위해 추천하는 난이도.
PolskI: Zalecane dla doświadczonych graczy szukających wyzwania.

description: Difficulty description when starting a new game - Extra Hard

Japanese: 自ら死を求めるプレイヤー向けの難易度

Portuguese (Brazil): Recomendado a jogadores com pressa para morrer.
Chinese (Simplified): 推荐给一心求死的玩家。
Chinese (Traditional): 推薦給一心求死的玩家。
Korean: 죽는 게 소원인 플레이어를 위해 추천하는 난이도.
PolskI: Zalecane dla graczy z życzeniem śmierć.

description: Keybind for the action in build menu to place, move, and upgrade a structure. These 3 actions use the same binding.
Japanese: 建築物を配置する / 移動 / にアップグレード
Chinese (Simplified): 放置建筑 / 移动 / 升级
Chinese (Traditional): 放置建築 / 移動 / 升級

Japanese: 解体する / 反転

description: Instruction to begin the game from the main menu
Japanese: Press any button to start
French: Appuyez sur une touche pour jouer

Japanese: クイックスタート

English: Quick Start allows you to bypass the introduction and tutorial sections of the game and jump right in to the action.
Japanese: 開幕の導入部分とチュートリアルをスキップしてゲームを開始できます。
Russian: Быстрый запуск позволит вам приступить к самому интересному, пропустив вступление и обучение.
French: Le démarrage rapide vous permet de passer l'introduction et le didacticiel afin de passer directement à l'action.
German: Der Schnellstart ermöglicht dir, die Einführungs- und Tutorialabschnitte des Spiels zu überspringen und sofort loszulegen.
Spanish: El Inicio rápido te permite omitir la presentación y el tutorial para pasar directamente a la acción.
Portuguese (Brazil): O Início Rápido permite passar as partes de introdução e tutorial do jogo e ir logo à ação.
Chinese (Simplified): 快速开始让您略过游戏的介绍与教学，直接开始游戏。
Chinese (Traditional): 快速開始讓您略過遊戲的介紹與教學，直接開始遊戲。
Korean: 게임의 인트로와 튜토리얼 부분을 건너뛰고 바로 게임을 시작할 수 있도록 합니다.
PolskI: Szybki start pozwala ominąć wprowadzenie i samouczek, aby od razu rozpocząć akcję.

description: Food
Japanese: ベリー

description: Food
English: A tasty ingredient for cooking meals.
Japanese: 料理を作るための材料

Spanish: Un sabroso ingrediente para preparar comidas.
Chinese (Simplified): 烹煮餐点用的可口食材。
Chinese (Traditional): 烹煮餐點用的可口食材。

description: Food
English: A simple, juicy berry sprung forth from nature's bounty.
Japanese: 大自然が生み出したみずみずしいベリー
French: Une baie savoureuse, fruit de la nature.
German: Eine einfache, saftige Beere, die der Fülle der Natur entsprungen ist.
Spanish: Una simple y jugosa baya, un regalo de la naturaleza.
Portuguese (Brazil): Uma fruta simples e suculenta presenteada pela natureza.
Chinese (Simplified): 源自大自然赠礼的莓果，朴实多汁。
Chinese (Traditional): 源自大自然贈禮的莓果，樸實多汁。

description: Currency- Ignore the key, its a simple gold coin. Used mainly for building & shops etc.
Japanese: 金貨

description: Currency
English: A currency used for all manner of things.
Japanese: 様々なことに利用できる通貨
Russian: Денежный знак, который используется для самых разных целей.
German: Eine Währung, die für alles Mögliche verwendet wird.
Spanish: Una forma de pago para intercambiar todo tipo de cosas.
Portuguese (Brazil): Tipo de dinheiro usado para uma variedade de coisas.
Chinese (Simplified): 能用于各种事物上的货币。
Chinese (Traditional): 能用於各種事物上的貨幣。

description: Currency
English: The lust for gold is oft all consuming of one's heart.
Japanese: 富への欲はしばしば、その者の心臓を食らいつくすものである
French: L'or consume les cœurs et excite les désirs les plus fous.
German: Die Gier nach Gold verzehrt oft das ganze Herz.
Spanish: La codicia acaba corrompiendo los corazones.
Portuguese (Brazil): Muitas vezes, o ouro consome o coração daquele que o deseja.
Chinese (Simplified): 追求金币的欲望常会吞噬一个人的心灵。
Chinese (Traditional): 追求金幣的慾望常會徹底佔據一個人的心靈。
Korean: 황금을 향한 열망은 종종 모든 것을 빼앗아가기 마련이다.
PolskI: Żądza złota często całkowicie pochłania serce człowieka.

description: Resources-Bones are used in rituals as a cost

description: Resources

Japanese: 秘密の儀式に使える供え物
Russian: Дар, который можно принести короне во время тайного ритуала.
French: Une offrande utilisée pour accomplir des rituels interdits.
German: Ein nützliches Opfer für geheime Rituale.
Spanish: Una ofrenda muy útil a la hora de realizar rituales clandestinos.
Portuguese (Brazil): Uma oferenda útil para rituais clandestinos.
Chinese (Simplified): 举行秘密仪式的有用祭品。
Chinese (Traditional): 舉行祕密儀式的有用祭品。

description: Resources

Russian: От ваших врагов останутся лишь кости.
German: Die Überbleibsel derer, die sich dir zu widersetzen wagen.
Spanish: Los restos de aquellos que se han opuesto a ti.
Portuguese (Brazil): Os resquícios daqueles que se oporiam a você.
PolskI: Pozostałości tych, którzy ci się sprzeciwiali.

description: Food - Salmon

Russian: Деликатесная рыба, которую едят только самые верные последователи.

description: Food - Blowfish

description:
Flower - Red
  Flowers are Used in making decorations
Japanese: ツバキ

description:
Flower - Red
  Flowers are Used in making decorations

Japanese: とても上品で美しい花。装飾目的や医療用途で使われる
Russian: Красивый цветок, известный своими целебными свойствами.

Spanish: Una delicada flor usada por su belleza y sus propiedades medicinales.

Flower - Red

Chinese (Simplified): 增加教徒忠诚度的小型礼物。

Japanese: あなたの気前の良さにも限りはあるようだ
German: Deine Großzügigkeit kennt ein paar Grenzen.
Chinese (Simplified): 你的慷慨还是有极限的。

description: Resource - These are used to make gold coins
Japanese: 金塊

description: Resource - These are used to make gold coins
English: A nugget of gold that can be refined into coin.
Japanese: 金貨へと精錬することのできる金塊
Russian: Кусок металла, который можно переплавить в монеты.
French: Une pépite d'or qui peut être transformée en pièce.
German: Ein Klumpen Gold, der zu Münzen verarbeitet werden kann.
Spanish: Una pepita de oro que se puede pulir para convertirla en una moneda.
Portuguese (Brazil): Uma pepita de ouro que pode ser refinada em uma moeda.
Chinese (Simplified): 可以精炼为金币的金块。
Chinese (Traditional): 可以精製成金幣的金塊。
PolskI: Sztabka złota, którą można przetopić na monety.

description: Resource - These are used to make gold coins
English: Said to be the tears of an ancient goddess.
Japanese: いにしえの女神が流した涙と言われている
Russian: По легенде, самородками стали слёзы древней богини.
French: On raconte que ce sont les larmes d'une déesse antique.
German: Es handelt sich angeblich um die Tränen einer uralten Gottheit.
Spanish: Se dice que son las lágrimas de una antigua diosa.
Portuguese (Brazil): Dizem que são as lágrimas de uma deusa antiga.
Chinese (Simplified): 据说是某位古代女神的眼泪。
Chinese (Traditional): 據說是某位古代女神的眼淚。
PolskI: Mówi się, że to łzy pradawnej bogini.

description: If you refine gold coins you get gold bars
Japanese: 金の延棒

description: If you refine gold coins you get gold bars
English: An expensive material used for building sacred structures.
Japanese: 神聖なる建造物を作る際に使われた貴重な素材
Russian: Ценный материал для возведения культовых построек.
French: Un matériau précieux utilisé pour construire des structures sacrées.
German: Ein teures Material, das für den Bau heiliger Bauten verwendet wird.
Spanish: Un material muy caro usado para construir cosas sagradas.
Portuguese (Brazil): Material caro usado para construir estruturas sagradas.
Chinese (Simplified): 用于建造神圣建筑物的昂贵材料。
Chinese (Traditional): 用於建造神聖建築物的昂貴材料。
Korean: 성스러운 건물을 짓는 데 사용하는 값비싼 재료입니다.
PolskI: Drogocenny materiał używany do budowy świętych budowli.

description: If you refine gold coins you get gold bars
English: Countless souls have been lost in pursuit of this glittering treasure.
Japanese: この光輝く宝を求め、数えきれない魂という魂が失われてきた
Russian: В погоне за блестящим металлом погибло немало душ.
French: Bien des âmes ont perdu la vie pour s'emparer de ce trésor étincelant.
German: Unzählige Seelen sind auf der Jagd nach dem glitzernden Schatz verschwunden.
Spanish: Infinitas almas se han perdido por el camino en busca de este brillante tesoro.
Portuguese (Brazil): Inúmeras almas se perderam em busca deste tesouro cintilante.
Chinese (Simplified): 追逐这种华丽宝物的过程夺走了无数条生命。
Chinese (Traditional): 追逐這種華麗寶物的過程奪走了無數條命。
Korean: 이 빛나는 보물을 쫓고자 수많은 생명이 사그라들었다.
PolskI: Niezliczone dusze zostały stracone w pogoni za tym błyszczącym skarbem.

description:
Resource
  This is like weeds etc.

Japanese: 太くて節くれだった雑草。手入れは一切されていない
German: Dick und knotig, rau und wild.
Spanish: Grueso y con nudos; tosco y salvaje.
Portuguese (Brazil): Espesso e fibroso, áspero e selvagem. Fortuna
Korean: 두껍고 매듭이 져있는, 야생과 같이 거칩니다.
PolskI: Gęste i sękate, szorstkie i dzikie.

description: Resource
Japanese: 木材

description: Resource
English: A simple material used for building structures.
Japanese: 建築物用の簡素な素材
French: Un matériau de base utilisé pour construire des structures.
German: Ein einfaches Material, das zum Bauen verwendet wird.
Spanish: Un material sencillo usado para construir estructuras.
Portuguese (Brazil): Material simples usado para construir estruturas.

Chinese (Traditional): 用於建造建築物的樸實材料。
PolskI: Prosty materiał używany do budowy konstrukcji.

description: Resource
English: A gentle blue glow pulses through the veins of this log.
Japanese: 木目は柔らかく青い光を放っている
Russian: Прожилки этого бревна испускают мягкий голубоватый свет.
French: Une douce lueur bleue traverse les veines de cette bûche.
German: Ein sanftes blaues Leuchten pulsiert durch die Adern dieses Klotzes.
Spanish: Una delicada luz azul brilla a través de las vetas de este tronco.
Portuguese (Brazil): Um brilho azul suave pulsa nas veias deste tronco.
Chinese (Simplified): 木头纹理发出有如脉动的温和蓝光。
Chinese (Traditional): 木頭紋理發出有如脈動的溫和藍光。
Korean: 이 통나무의 핏줄을 따라 부드러운 푸른 빛이 맥동한다.
PolskI: Delikatny niebieski blask pulsuje w żyłach tej kłody.

description: Resource
Japanese: 木板

description: Resource
English: A material used for building sturdy structures.
Japanese: 頑丈な建築物を作る際に使われる素材
French: Un matériau utilisé pour construire des structures solides.
German: Ein Material, das zum Bau stabiler Strukturen verwendet wird.
Spanish: Un material usado para construir estructuras fuertes.
Portuguese (Brazil): Material usado para construir estruturas robustas.
Chinese (Simplified): 用于建造稳固建筑物的材料。
Chinese (Traditional): 用於建造穩固建築物的材料。
PolskI: Materiał używany do budowy wytrzymałych konstrukcji.

description: Resource
English: So we bend nature to our will in pursuit of order.
Japanese: 秩序を求め、我らは自然を意のままに屈服させる
Russian: Стремясь к порядку, мы подчиняем природу своей воле.
French: Nous soumettons la nature à notre volonté afin de rétablir l'ordre.
German: So biegen wir uns die Natur zurecht, um Ordnung zu schaffen.
Spanish: Doblegamos la naturaleza a nuestra voluntad en busca del orden.
Portuguese (Brazil): Moldamos a natureza na nossa busca pela ordem.
Chinese (Simplified): 我们让自然服从自己，以便追求秩序。
Chinese (Traditional): 我們讓自然服從自己，以便追求秩序。
Korean: 질서를 위해 자연을 우리 뜻대로 휘어버렸다.
PolskI: Więc naginamy naturę do naszej woli w dążeniu do porządku.

description: Food

Japanese: 思わず噛みつきたくなる、栄養満点の食料
French: Un aliment riche à se mettre sous la dent.
Spanish: Un alimento muy nutritivo al que puedes hincarle el diente.
Portuguese (Brazil): Uma refeição nutritiva para você cravar seus dentes.
Chinese (Simplified): 有营养的食物，可大口咬下。
Chinese (Traditional): 有營養的食物，可大口咬下。
Korean: 침이 흐르게 만드는 영양가 많은 음식입니다.
PolskI: Odżywcze jedzenie, w które można wgryźć się z apetytem.

description: Food

Russian: Животное приняло смерть, чтобы жили вы.
French: De la chair fraîche et sanglante.
German: Tierisches Fleisch, reichhaltig, dick und blutig.
Spanish: La carne de las bestias: abundante, gruesa y sangrienta.
Portuguese (Brazil): A carne das bestas. Rica, espessa e sangrenta.
Chinese (Simplified): 野兽的肉，味浓厚实，带血。
Chinese (Traditional): 野獸的肉，味濃厚實，帶血。
Korean: 짐승의 살, 육즙 많고, 두껍고, 피로 가득차있다.
PolskI: Mięso bestii, bogate, gęste i krwawe.

description: Food
Japanese: 信者肉

description: Food
English: The harvested meat of one who once followed you.
Japanese: 食事を作るための栄養満点の材料
Russian: Плоть того, кто чтил ваш культ при жизни.
French: La viande de ceux qui vous ont servi autrefois.
German: Fleisch, das von jemandem stammt, der dir einst gefolgt ist.
Spanish: La carne de uno de tus adeptos.
Portuguese (Brazil): A carne colhida de alguém que costumava te seguir.
Chinese (Simplified): 从生前追随你的教徒身上获得的肉。
Chinese (Traditional): 從生前追隨你的教徒身上採集下的肉。
Korean: 한때 당신을 따랐던 자의 고기를 수확한 것입니다.
PolskI: Zebrane mięso kogoś, kto kiedyś cię śledził.

description: Food
English: They gave their soul, you took their flesh.
Japanese: 分厚いケモノの肉。どこか血なまぐさい
French: Ils vous ont donné leur âme, vous avez pris leur viande.
German: Diese Person hat ihre Seele gegeben, doch du hast ihr Fleisch genommen.
Spanish: Te ofreció su alma y tú tomaste su carne.
Portuguese (Brazil): Eles te deram a alma, você pegou suas carnes.
Chinese (Simplified): 教徒献出自己的灵魂，你取用其肉身。
Chinese (Traditional): 教徒獻出自己的靈魂，你取用其肉身。
Korean: 그들은 혼을 바쳤고, 당신은 육신을 받았다.
PolskI: Oddali swoją duszę, ty wziąłeś ich ciało.

description: Food - Rotten
Japanese: 腐った信者肉

description: Food - Rotten
English: The rotten meat of one who once followed you.
Japanese: かつて、あなたを信じ敬っていた者の腐った肉
Russian: Разложившаяся плоть того, кто чтил ваш культ при жизни.
French: La viande pourrie de ceux qui vous ont servi autrefois.
German: Vergammeltes Fleisch, das von jemandem stammt, der dir einst gefolgt ist.
Spanish: La carne podrida de uno de tus adeptos.
Portuguese (Brazil): A carne apodrecida de alguém que costumava te seguir.
Chinese (Simplified): 生前追随你的教徒身上的腐肉。
Chinese (Traditional): 生前追隨你的教徒身上的腐肉。
Korean: 한때 당신을 따랐던 자의 썩은 고기입니다.
PolskI: Zgniłe mięso kogoś, kto kiedyś cię śledził.

description: Food - Rotten
English: They gave their soul, you took their flesh.
Japanese: 信者は魂を捧げ、あなたはその肉を得た
French: Ils vous ont donné leur âme, vous avez pris leur viande.
German: Diese Person hat ihre Seele gegeben, doch du hast ihr Fleisch genommen.
Spanish: Te ofreció su alma y tú tomaste su carne.
Portuguese (Brazil): Eles te deram a alma, você pegou suas carnes.
Chinese (Simplified): 教徒献出自己的灵魂，你取用其肉身。
Chinese (Traditional): 教徒獻出自己的靈魂，你取用其肉身。
Korean: 그들은 혼을 바쳤고, 당신은 육신을 받았다.
PolskI: Oddali swoją duszę, ty wziąłeś ich ciało.

description:
Item
  Get this from killing a boss, is a heart from a boss
Japanese: 異端者の心臓

description:
Item
  Get this from killing a boss, is a heart from a boss
English: Used in rituals to unlock new weapons and curses.
Japanese: 儀式で使うことで新しい武器や呪いをアンロックできる
Russian: Дар, который можно принести короне, чтобы открыть новые виды оружия и проклятий.
French: Une offrande utilisée pour accomplir des rituels permettant de débloquer armes et maléfices.
German: Wird in Ritualen verwendet, um neue Waffen und Flüche freizuschalten.
Spanish: Usado en rituales para desbloquear nuevas armas y maldiciones.
Portuguese (Brazil): Usado em rituais para desbloquear novas armas e maldições.
Chinese (Simplified): 在仪式中用于解锁新的武器与咒术。
Chinese (Traditional): 在儀式中用於解鎖新的武器與咒術。
Korean: 새로운 무기와 저주를 해금하는 의식에 쓰입니다.
PolskI: Używane w rytuałach do odblokowywania nowych broni i klątw.

description:
Item
  Get this from killing a boss, is a heart from a boss
English: A heart cast in vile, impermeable, unrelenting terror.
Japanese: 吐き気を催すような冷徹なる恐怖を経験した心臓
French: Un cœur empli d'une indicible terreur.
German: Ein Herz voller abscheulichem und unerbittlichem Schrecken.
Spanish: Un corazón impregnado de un miserable e incesante terror.
Portuguese (Brazil): Um coração moldado em terror vil, impermeável e implacável.
Chinese (Simplified): 以邪恶、无法渗透、无情的恐惧铸成的心脏。
Chinese (Traditional): 以邪惡、無法滲透、無情的恐懼鑄成的心臟。
Korean: 극도로 불쾌하며, 빠져나올 수 없는 무한한 공포에 빠진 심장이다.
PolskI: Serce odlane w nikczemnym, nieprzeniknionym, nieustępliwym terrorze.

description:
Item
  Used for brainwashing Followers
Japanese: 洗脳キノコ

description:
Item
  Used for brainwashing Followers
English: An insidious fungus, with an intoxicating musk.
Japanese: 魅力的な香りを放つ、危険なキノコ
German: Ein heimtückischer Pilz mit einem berauschendem Moschusduft.
Spanish: Un hongo malicioso que desprende un almizcle embriagador.
Portuguese (Brazil): Um cogumelo traiçoeiro com um odor intoxicante.
Chinese (Simplified): 不知不觉中产生危害的菌类，带有使人中毒的麝香。
Chinese (Traditional): 不知不覺中產生影響的蕈菇，帶有使人中毒的麝香。
Korean: 서서히 퍼지는 곰팡이로, 유독한 냄새가 납니다.

description:
Item
  Used for brainwashing Followers
Japanese: 堕落は新しい何かを生み出す
French: De la décomposition fleurit la folie.
German: Aus dem Zerfall entsteht etwas Neues.
Spanish: De la putrefacción florece algo nuevo.
Chinese (Simplified): 凋萎之中迸发出新生机。
Chinese (Traditional): 凋萎之中迸發出新生機。
PolskI: Z rozkładu rodzi się coś nowego.

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: 花のネックレス

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: 信者の祈念生成速度が上昇する
Russian: Украшение, помогающее последователю выражать преданность быстрее.
French: Permet à un adepte de générer de la dévotion plus rapidement.
Spanish: El adepto generará devoción más rápido.
Portuguese (Brazil): O Seguidor gerará devoção mais rapidamente
Chinese (Simplified): 增加教徒产生虔诚度的速度
Chinese (Traditional): 教徒產生虔誠值的速度增加

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: この花が枯れることはない
German: Diese Blume blüht in alle Ewigkeit.

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: 羽根のネックレス

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
English: Follower will have increased movement speed
Japanese: 信者の移動速度が上昇する
French: Permet à un adepte de se déplacer plus rapidement.
German: Das Bewegungstempo deiner Anhänger erhöht sich.
Spanish: El adepto se moverá más rápido.
Portuguese (Brazil): O Seguidor terá a velocidade de movimento aumentada
PolskI: Wyznawca będzie miał zwiększoną prędkość ruchu

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
English: Imbued with the vitality of a bird.
Japanese: 鳥が持つ生命力が込められている
German: Mit der Vitalität eines Vogels durchtränkt.
Spanish: Impregnado de la vitalidad de los pájaros.
Portuguese (Brazil): Imbuído da vitalidade de um pássaro.

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: 頭蓋骨のネックレス

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
English: Follower will live an unnaturally long life, double what would usually be expected.
Japanese: 信者の寿命が長くなり、本来の2倍の長さを生き続ける
Russian: Украшение, увеличивающее продолжительность жизни последователя вдвое.
French: Permet à un adepte de vivre deux fois plus longtemps.
German: Der Anhänger lebt unnatürlich lange; doppelt so lange wie gewöhnlich.
Spanish: El adepto tendrá una vida el doble de larga de lo normal.
Portuguese (Brazil): O Seguidor terá uma vida estranhamente longa, o dobro do que se esperaria.
Chinese (Simplified): 教徒的寿命将异常增加，增长为预期寿命的二倍。
Chinese (Traditional): 教徒的壽命將異常增加，成為預期壽命的二倍。
Korean: 추종자가 비자연적으로 오래 살며, 예상 수명의 2배를 살게 됩니다.
PolskI: Wyznawca będzie żył nienaturalnie długo, dwa razy dłużej niż zwykle.

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: 頭蓋骨は永久に笑みを浮かべ続ける
German: Ein Schädel wird auf Ewigkeiten grinsen.
Portuguese (Brazil): Um crânio sorrirá para todo o sempre.

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: 大自然のネックレス

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: 信者が集める素材の量が増える
Russian: Украшение, помогающее последователю собирать больше материалов.
French: Permet à un adepte de récolter des ressources supplémentaires.
Portuguese (Brazil): O Seguidor coletará bônus de recursos

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
English: Beauty is in the eye of the bearer.
Japanese: 美しさとは、身につけた者の目に宿るものだ
Russian: Природная красота видна даже в щепке.
French: La beauté est dans les yeux de celui qui le porte.
German: Die Schönheit liegt im Auge des Trägers.
Spanish: La belleza está en los ojos del que mira.
Portuguese (Brazil): A beleza está nos olhos de quem usa.

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: 月のネックレス

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: 信者が一切睡眠を取らなくなる
Russian: Украшение, помогающее последователю обходиться без сна.
French: Permet à un adepte de ne jamais avoir besoin de dormir.

description: You can give necklaces to followers found in dunngeon, they will give a trait to the follower
Japanese: 我という夢を見よ

description: Resource - is poop used to fertilize crops
Japanese: 肥料

description: Resource - is poop used to fertilize crops
English: Rich in nutrients, useful on Farm Plots.
Japanese: ミネラルを多く含んでいる。農作地で使える
French: Riche en nutriments. À utiliser sur les parcelles agricoles.
German: Reich an Nährstoffen, nützlich auf Ackerparzellen.
Spanish: Rico en nutrientes, muy útil para las parcelas.
Portuguese (Brazil): Rico em nutrientes, útil para Terrenos Agrícolas.
PolskI: Bogaty w składniki odżywcze, przydatny na polach uprawnych.

description: Resource - is poop used to fertilize crops
English: Doesn't smell too good... still warm.
Japanese: 悪臭を放っている…まだ温かい
French: Ça ne sent pas très bon, et... c'est encore chaud ?
German: Riecht nicht besonders gut … ist noch warm.
Spanish: No huele muy bien... Y está calentita.
Portuguese (Brazil): O cheiro não é dos melhores... E ainda está quente.
Chinese (Simplified): 味道闻起来不太好……还温温的。
Chinese (Traditional): 味道聞起來不太好……還溫溫的。

description: Food - farming
Japanese: カボチャ

description: Food - farming
Japanese: 丸々と大きな食料

description: Food - farming
English: The fruits of a bountiful harvest.
Japanese: 豊作を象徴するかのような野菜
Spanish: Los frutos de una cosecha abundante.
Portuguese (Brazil): Os frutos de uma colheita farta.

description:
Item
  Eyeball of a killed witness boss, this boss has three eyes with one big central one. Google Beholder for similar kind of thing
Japanese: 抜け落ちた魔眼

description:
Item
  Eyeball of a killed witness boss, this boss has three eyes with one big central one. Google Beholder for similar kind of thing. The player must take it to a character called "Plimbo" (see character reference)
English: Take this to <color=yellow>Plimbo</color> for a reward.
Japanese: <color=yellow>プリンボ</color>に渡すことで報酬がもらえる
French: À apporter à <color=yellow>Plimbo</color> pour recevoir une récompense.
German: Bringst du es zu <color=yellow>Plimbo</color>, erhältst du eine Belohnung.
Spanish: Llévale esto a <color=yellow>Plimbo</color> y consigue una recompensa.
Portuguese (Brazil): Leve isso para o <color=yellow>Plimbo</color> e ganhe uma recompensa.
Chinese (Simplified): 可拿给<color=yellow>普霖波</color>换取奖励。
Chinese (Traditional): 可拿給<color=yellow>普霖波</color>換取獎勵。
PolskI: Zanieś to do <color=yellow>Plimbo</color>, aby otrzymać nagrodę.

description:
Item
  Eyeball of a killed witness boss, this boss has three eyes with one big central one. Google Beholder for similar kind of thing
English: Seer of sins both faded in time and still yet to pass.
Japanese: 過去のものになった罪、まだ消えていない罪、その両方を見るもの
Russian: Он видит грехи, которыми полнится и прошлое, и будущее.
French: Souvenir de péchés passés et à venir.
German: Seher der Sünden, sowohl der mit der Zeit verblassten als auch der noch ausstehenden.
Spanish: Vidente de los pecados del pasado y de los que aún están por llegar.
Portuguese (Brazil): Vê os pecados esquecidos e aqueles que ainda espreitam.
Chinese (Simplified): 见证随时光消逝以及尚未降临之罪。
Chinese (Traditional): 見證隨時光消逝以及尚未降臨之罪。
Korean: 죄를 바라보는 눈은 시간의 흐름에 낡았지만 아직 빛을 잃지 않았다.
PolskI: Widzący grzechy zarówno te dawne, jak i te, które jeszcze nadejdą.

description: Food - farming
Japanese: カリフラワー

description: Food - farming

Japanese: 味もよくて健康にいい、誰もが愛する食料
French: Ingrédient pour concocter des plats sains.
German: Leckere und gesunde Zutat zum Kochen.
Spanish: Un ingrediente delicioso y saludable para preparar comidas.
Portuguese (Brazil): Um ingrediente de cozinha delicioso e saudável.

Chinese (Traditional): 美味又健康的料理食材。
PolskI: Pyszny i zdrowy składnik do gotowania.

description: Food - farming
English: Looks like brains tastes like paper.
Japanese: 脳みそのような見た目、紙のような味がする
Russian: На вид — как мозг, на вкус — как бумага.
French: Ressemble à une cervelle, a le goût de papier.
German: Sieht aus wie ein Hirn und schmeckt wie Papier.
Spanish: Parece un cerebro y sabe a papel.
Portuguese (Brazil): Parece que cérebros têm gosto de papel.
PolskI: Wygląda jak mózg, smakuje jak papier.

description:
Resource - farming (Used to grow mushrooms)
  A pun; fungi is another name for mushroom and sounds like "fun guy" in English
English: Neither plant nor animal but imbued with intoxicating flesh.
Japanese: 植物でも動物でもないが、魅力的な食料となる可能性を秘めている
French: Ni végétales, ni animales, mais définitivement envoûtantes.
German: Ist weder Pflanze noch Tier, birgt aber berauschendes Fleisch.
Spanish: No es ni planta ni animal, pero su carne es muy tóxica.
Portuguese (Brazil): Não é planta, mas tem uma polpa intoxicante.
Chinese (Simplified): 不是植物也不是动物，菇肉却会令人中毒。
Chinese (Traditional): 不是植物也不是動物，菇肉卻會令人中毒。
Korean: 짐승도 식물도 아닌 것이 육신에 달라붙어있다.
PolskI: Ani roślina, ani zwierzę, ale nasycony odurzającym mięsem.

description: Devotion is generated by worshippers praying at your shrine. It's like a white soul that flies out of them
Japanese: 祈念

description: Devotion is generated by worshippers praying at your shrine. It's like a white soul that flies out of them
Japanese: 教団の教祖が扱う通貨
Russian: То, в чём оценивается влияние духовных вождей.
Spanish: La moneda de los líderes de sectas.
Portuguese (Brazil): A moeda dos líderes de Cultos.

description: Devotion is generated by worshippers praying at your shrine. It's like a white soul that flies out of them
English: Energy generated by the worshipping of your Followers.
Japanese: 信者が祈りを捧げることにより生み出されたエネルギー
French: Énergie générée grâce aux prières de vos adeptes.
German: Energie, die durch die Gebete deiner Anhänger erzeugt wird.
Spanish: Energía generada por las alabanzas de tus adeptos.
Portuguese (Brazil): Energia gerada pela adoração dos seus Seguidores.
Chinese (Simplified): 你的教徒通过奉拜产生的能量。
Chinese (Traditional): 你的教徒透過奉拜產生的能量。
PolskI: Energia generowana przez kult swoich Wyznawców.

description: Resource - like a rock
Japanese: 石

description: Resource - like a rock
Japanese: 便利な建築素材
French: Un matériau de construction très utile.
Spanish: Un material muy útil para construir.

description: Resource - like a rock
English: Ancient splintered shards of the very earth itself.
Japanese: 大地そのもののかけら
German: Uralte zersplitterte Scherben der Erde selbst.
Spanish: Antiguos fragmentos astillados de la mismísima tierra.
Portuguese (Brazil): Antigos fragmentos vindos da própria terra.
Chinese (Simplified): 大地本身碎裂产生的古老碎石。
Chinese (Traditional): 大地本身碎裂產生的古老碎石。

description: Resource - Refined version of stone
Japanese: 石材

description: Resource - Refined version of stone
English: A material used for building sturdy structures.
Japanese: 頑丈な建築物を作る際に使われる素材
French: Un matériau utilisé pour construire des structures solides.
German: Ein Material, das zum Bau stabiler Strukturen verwendet wird.
Spanish: Un material usado para construir estructuras fuertes.
Portuguese (Brazil): Material usado para construir estruturas robustas.
Chinese (Simplified): 用于建造稳固建筑物的材料。
Chinese (Traditional): 用於建造穩固建築物的材料。
PolskI: Materiał używany do budowy wytrzymałych konstrukcji.

description: Resource - Refined version of stone
English: We mould the very earth itself to build our city.
Japanese: 大地から削りだした岩の形を整え、我らは文明を作り上げる
Russian: Мы возводим свой город, меняя облик земли.
French: Nous façonnons l'écorce terrestre pour créer notre foyer.
German: Wir geben sogar der Erde selbst eine neue Form, um unsere Stadt zu bauen.
Spanish: Moldeamos la tierra para construir nuestras ciudades.
Portuguese (Brazil): Moldamos a terra para construir nossa cidade.
Chinese (Simplified): 我们形塑大地盘石，建造城市。
Chinese (Traditional): 我們形塑大地磐石，建造城市。
Korean: 대지 그 자체를 뭉쳐 도시를 짓게 한다.
PolskI: Kształtujemy samą ziemię, aby zbudować nasze miasto.

description:
Resource
  pieces of gem stones used to build decorations
Japanese: クリスタルのかけら

description:
Resource
  pieces of gem stones used to build decorations
English: A material used for building pretty decorations.
Japanese: 美しい装飾品を作るための素材
Russian: Материал, из которого можно создать украшения для поселения.
French: Un matériau utilisé pour fabriquer de jolies décorations.
German: Ein Material, das zum Bau von schönen Dekorationen verwendet wird.
Spanish: Un material usado para construir bonitas decoraciones.
Portuguese (Brazil): Material usado para construir belas decorações.
Chinese (Simplified): 用于建造漂亮装饰的材料。
Chinese (Traditional): 用於建造漂亮裝飾的材料。
PolskI: Materiał używany do tworzenia ładnych dekoracji.

description:
Resource
  pieces of gem stones used to build decorations
English: Emanates an ominous aura, beating as if it were a heart.
Japanese: まるで心臓かのように鼓動しては、不気味なオーラを放っている
Russian: Странная пульсирующая аура окружает этот камень.
French: Bat comme un cœur vibrant. Il en émane une aura inquiétante.
German: Strahlt eine unheimliche Aura aus; schlägt, als wäre es ein Herz.
Spanish: Emana un aura inquietante, late como un corazón.
Portuguese (Brazil): Emana uma aura sinistra, pulsando como um coração.
Chinese (Simplified): 散发出不祥灵气，像心脏般跳动着。
Chinese (Traditional): 散發出不祥靈氣，像心臟般跳動著。
Korean: 불길한 기운을 내뱉으며, 마치 심장인 것처럼 맥동한다.
PolskI: Emanuje złowrogą aurą, bijąc jak serce.

description:
Resource
  Balls of spider silk made from their webs, used to build decorations
Japanese: クモ糸

description:
Resource
  Balls of spider silk made from their webs, used to build decorations
English: Delicate yet strong, pulled from the webs of spiders used for building decorations.
Japanese: クモの巣から集めた、装飾品を作るための素材。繊細でありながらとても頑丈
Russian: Тонкая, но прочная паучья нить, из которой можно создать украшения для поселения.
French: Délicate mais extrêmement solide. Extrait de toile d'araignée utilisé pour créer des décorations.
German: Zart aber kräftig; wird aus Spinnennetzen gewonnen und für Gebäudedekorationen verwendet.
Spanish: Delicada pero resistente, se extrae de las telarañas y sirve para construir decoraciones.
Portuguese (Brazil): Delicada, porém forte. É retirada de teias de aranhas e usada para decorar construções.
Chinese (Simplified): 纤细但强韧，从蜘蛛网上抽出，可用于建造装饰。
Chinese (Traditional): 纖細但強韌，從蜘蛛網上抽出，可用於建造裝飾。
Korean: 섬세하지만 강하며, 건물 장식에 쓰이는 거미줄입니다.
PolskI: Delikatna, ale mocna, pozyskiwana z pajęczyn używanych do dekoracji.

description:
Resource
  Balls of spider silk made from their webs, used to build decorations
English: It shimmers with a majestic quality.
Japanese: 糸はかすかに光を放っており、その品質は最上級だ

description: Healing Item
Japanese: ブルーハート

description: Healing Item
Japanese: ブルーハート（半）

description: Healing item
Japanese: レッドハート

description: Healing Item
Japanese: レッドハート（半）

description: Healing Item
Japanese: ブラックハート

description: Followers you have
Japanese: 信者

description: RESOURCES REF: https://www.dropbox.com/s/bj24bc83qs695ti/Resources.zip?dl=0
Food
Japanese: 肉の小片

description: Food
Japanese: 痩せこけた肉のかけら
Spanish: Un pedazo de carne un poco escuálido.
Portuguese (Brazil): Um pedaço de carne bem magro.

description: Food
English: Barely more than gristle and bone
Japanese: 一応、骨と筋だけではない
German: Kaum mehr als Knorpel und Knochen.
Spanish: No es más que un puñado de cartílagos y huesos.
Chinese (Simplified): 软骨跟骨头上的一点点肉
Chinese (Traditional): 軟骨跟骨頭上的一點點肉
Korean: 연골과 뼈보다는 조금 더 있긴 하다.
PolskI: Ledwo więcej niż chrząstka i kość

description: Item used to unlock player costumes that have game altering properties.
Japanese: 聖なる魔除け

description: Description of the holy talisman item
English: Mystical relics that the Red Crown can use to unlock new <color=#FFD201>Fleeces.
Japanese: 神秘の込められた遺物。赤き王冠が新しい<color=#FFD201>羊毛</color>をアンロックするのに必要
Russian: Реликвия огромной силы, которую алая корона может поглощать для создания новых <color=#FFD201>рун</color>.
French: Reliques antiques permettant de débloquer de nouvelles <color=#FFD201>pelisses</color>.
German: Mystische Relikte, die die Rote Krone verwenden kann, um neue <color=#FFD201>Vliese</color> freizuschalten.
Spanish: Una mística reliquia que la Corona Roja puede usar para desbloquear nuevos <color=#FFD201>vellocinos</color>.
Portuguese (Brazil): Relíquias místicas que a Coroa Vermelha pode usar para desbloquear novas <color=#FFD201>Lãs.
Chinese (Simplified): 神秘的圣物，能让红眼冠用于解锁新<color=#FFD201>毛纺。
Chinese (Traditional): 神祕的聖物，能讓紅眼冠用於解鎖新<color=#FFD201>毛紡。
Korean: 붉은 왕관이 새로운 <color=#FFD201>양털을 해금하는 데 사용되는 신비로운 유물입니다.
PolskI: Mistyczne relikwie, których Czerwona Korona może użyć do odblokowania nowych <color=#FFD201>Run.

description: Lore for the holy talisman item
English: Scattered to the four winds, the talisman yearns to be whole once more.
Japanese: 四方に散らばった魔除けは、再び1つとなることを切望している
Russian: Осколки, разбросанные по миру, ждут воссоединения.
French: Dispersés aux quatre vents, les éclats de talisman doivent être réunis.
German: In alle vier Winde verstreut, sehnt sich der Talisman danach, wieder vollständig zu sein.
Spanish: Sus fragmentos fueron esparcidos a los cuatro vientos.
Portuguese (Brazil): Espalhado pelos quatro ventos, o talismã espera ficar inteiro de novo.
Chinese (Simplified): 碎到四分五裂的护身符希望能再次完整。
Chinese (Traditional): 碎到四分五裂的護身符希望能再次完整。
Korean: 네 갈래 바람으로 흩어진, 부적은 다시 하나가 됨을 갈망한다.
PolskI: Rozsiane na cztery wiatry, talizman pragnie być znów cały.

description: Description of the holy talisman item
English: Mystical relics that can unlock new <color=#FFD201>Fleeces</color> from the Altar in your Temple.
Japanese: 神秘の込められた遺物。教会堂内の講壇にて、新たな<color=#FFD201>羊毛</color>をアンロックできる
Russian: Древняя реликвия, которая позволяет открывать новые <color=#FFD201>руна</color> в храме.
French: Les reliques mystiques permettent de débloquer de nouvelles <color=#FFD201>pelisses</color> sur l'Autel du Temple.
German: Mystische Relikte, die neue <color=#FFD201>Vliese</color> am Altar deines Tempels freischalten können.
Spanish: Las reliquias místicas pueden desbloquear nuevos <color=#FFD201>vellocinos</color> en el altar de tu templo.
Portuguese (Brazil): Relíquias Místicas que podem debloquear novas <color=#FFD201>Lãs</color> no Altar do seu Templo.
Chinese (Simplified): 能在圣殿祭坛解锁新<color=#FFD201>毛纺</color>的神秘古物。
Chinese (Traditional): 能在聖殿祭壇解鎖新<color=#FFD201>毛紡</color>的神祕古物。
Korean: 신비로운 유물은 사원의 제단에서 새로운 <color=#FFD201>양털</color>을 해금할 수 있게 해줍니다.
PolskI: Mistyczne relikwie, które mogą odblokować nowe <color=#FFD201>Runy</color> z Ołtarza w Twojej Świątyni.

description:
Item
  Get this from killing a boss, is a heart from a boss
English: Unholy hearts that can unlock new <color=#FFD201>Crown Abilities</color> from the Altar in your Temple.
Japanese: 不浄なる心臓。教会堂内の講壇にて、新たな<color=#FFD201>王冠の権能</color>をアンロックするのに必要
Russian: Порочное сердце, которое позволяет открывать новые <color=#FFD201>способности короны</color> в храме.
French: Les cœurs impies permettent de débloquer de nouveaux <color=#FFD201>Pouvoirs de la Couronne</color> sur l'Autel du Temple.
German: Unheilige Herzen, die neue <color=#FFD201>Kronenfähigkeiten</color> am Altar deines Tempels freischalten können.
Spanish: Los corazones impíos pueden desbloquear nuevos <color=#FFD201>poderes de la corona</color> en el altar de tu templo.
Portuguese (Brazil): Corações profanos que podem debloquear novas <color=#FFD201>Habilidades da Coroa</color> no Altar do seu Templo.
Chinese (Simplified): 能在圣殿祭坛解锁新<color=#FFD201>圣冠能力</color>的不洁之心。
Chinese (Traditional): 能在聖殿祭壇解鎖新<color=#FFD201>聖冠能力</color>的不潔之心。
Korean: 불경한 심장은 사원의 제단에서 새로운 <color=#FFD201>왕관 능력</color>을 해금할 수 있게 해줍니다.
PolskI: Nieświęte serca, które mogą odblokować nowe <color=#FFD201>Zdolności Korony</color> z Ołtarza w Twojej Świątyni.

description: A scroll that unlocks a new follower form
Japanese: 信者のスキン

description: A scroll that unlocks a new decoration you can build at your base
Japanese: 設計図

description: Item used to unlock player costumes that have game altering properties.
Japanese: 戒律石のかけら
Spanish: Fragmento de piedra de los mandamientos

description: Description of the holy talisman item
English: Commandment Stones that can be used to declare new <color=#FFD201>Doctrines</cult> from the Altar in your Temple.
Japanese: 教会堂の講壇にて、新しい<color=#FFD201>教条</cult>を宣言する際に使うための戒律石
Russian: Священный камень, на котором можно высечь новую <color=#FFD201>заповедь</cult> в храме.
French: Pierres de commandement qui peuvent être utilisées pour adopter de nouvelles <color=#FFD201>doctrines</cult> sur l'Autel du Temple.
German: Gebotssteine, die am Altar deines Tempels verwendet werden können, um neue <color=#FFD201>Doktrinen</cult> zu verkünden.
Spanish: Piedras de los mandamientos que puedes usar para declarar nuevas <color=#FFD201>doctrinas</cult> en el altar de tu templo.
Portuguese (Brazil): Pedras da Lei que podem ser usadas para declarar novas <color=#FFD201>Doutrinas</cult> no Altar do seu Templo.
Chinese (Simplified): 可以用来在圣殿祭坛颁布新<color=#FFD201>教条</cult>的戒律石。
Chinese (Traditional): 可以用來在聖殿祭壇頒布新<color=#FFD201>教條</cult>的戒律石。
Korean: 계명석은 사원의 제단에서 새로운 <color=#FFD201>교리</cult>를 선포하는 데 사용됩니다.
PolskI: Kamienie Przykazania, które można użyć do ogłoszenia nowych <color=#FFD201>Doktryn</cult> z Ołtarza w Twojej Świątyni.

description: Lore for the holy talisman item
English: Praise be the mighty Lamb, for your word is law.
Japanese: 偉大なる子羊を称えよ、汝の言葉は法なれば
Russian: Славься, великий ягнёнок, ибо твоё слово есть закон.
French: Gloire à l'Agneau tout-puissant car votre parole fait Loi.
German: Gelobt sei das mächtige Lamm, denn dein Wort ist Gesetz.
Spanish: Alabado sea el Cordero todopoderoso, pues su palabra es ley.
Portuguese (Brazil): Louvado seja o poderoso Cordeiro, pois sua palavra é a lei.
Chinese (Simplified): 赞叹伟大的圣羊，圣羊之言即为律法。
Chinese (Traditional): 讚嘆偉大的聖羊，聖羊之言即為律法。
Korean: 강대한 어린 양을 찬양할지라, 그대의 말이 곧 법이니.
PolskI: Chwała potężnemu Barankowi, bo twoje słowo jest prawem.

description: Tarot Card
Japanese: タロットカード

description: A scroll that unlocks a new decoration you can build at your base
Japanese: 設計図

description: Item - a snails shell. Used to be part of a shrine that you can place it in
Japanese: 殻

description: Item - a snails shell. Used to be part of a shrine that you can place it in
English: It looks like it was once part of a shrine of some kind...
Japanese: 祭壇かなにかの一部に使われていたようだが…
Russian: Небольшая раковина, которая раньше была частью некоего алтаря.
French: Elle semble faire partie d'une sorte d'autel...
German: Sieht aus, als gehörte es einst zu einer Art Schrein ...
Spanish: Parece que antes formaba parte de una especie de santuario...
Portuguese (Brazil): Parece que isso fazia parte de um tipo de santuário...
Chinese (Simplified): 看起来曾经是某种圣坛的一部分……
Chinese (Traditional): 看起來曾經是某種聖壇的一部分……
PolskI: Wygląda, jakby kiedyś stanowiło część jakiegoś rodzaju świątyni...

description: Item - a snails shell. Used to be part of a shrine that you can place it in
English: Once noble armor, now discarded debris.
Japanese: かつては気高く身を守る鎧だったもの。今となってはただのゴミ
Russian: То, что служило надёжным доспехом, стало забытым хламом.
French: Autrefois foyer d'une valeureuse créature, aujourd'hui simple déchet.
German: Einst eine edle Rüstung, jetzt ausrangierter Schutt.
Spanish: Antaño noble armadura, ahora basura abandonada.
Portuguese (Brazil): Antes uma armadura nobre, agora restos descartados.
Chinese (Simplified): 昔日的高贵护甲，如今成了弃置残骸。
Chinese (Traditional): 昔日的高貴護甲，如今成了棄置殘骸。
Korean: 한때 고귀한 갑옷이었지만, 이제는 버려진 쓰레기입니다.
PolskI: Niegdyś szlachetna zbroja, teraz odrzucone szczątki.

description:
Speaking: Player (the Lamb)
  Option Wheel
  In the intro, in response to The One Who Waits, the main antagonist of the game. The Lamb agrees to start a cult for him.
Japanese: はい。

description:
Speaking: Player (the Lamb)
  Option Wheel
  In the intro, in response to The One Who Waits, the main antagonist of the game. The Lamb agrees to start a cult for him but is more certain.
Japanese: 仰せのままに。

description:
Speaking: The One Who Waits
  The One Who Waits knows the player was killed in the opening cut scene, but can help them.
English: Come closer. Fear not, for though you are <shake>already dead,</shake> I still have <wave>need of you.</wave>
Japanese: そう怖がるでない。お前は確かに<shake>死んだ身</shake>だが、我にはまだ<wave>お前が必要</wave>なのだ。
Russian: Подойди ближе, не бойся. Тебя <shake>изгнали из мира живых</shake>, но твой путь <wave>ещё не закончен</wave>.
French: Approche. N'aie crainte, <shake>car bien que tu aies déjà rencontré la mort, </shake><wave>j'ai encore besoin de toi.</wave>
German: Komm näher. Fürchte dich nicht, denn obwohl du <shake>bereits tot</shake> bist, habe ich noch <wave>Verwendung für dich</wave>.
Spanish: Acércate. No temas, pues <shake>ya has muerto</shake> y <wave>te necesito</wave>.
Portuguese (Brazil): Aproxime-se. Não tenha medo. Apesar de você <shake>ter morrido</shake>, ainda é <wave>útil para mim</wave>.
Chinese (Simplified): 靠近一点。别害怕，虽然你<shake>已经死了，</shake>我还是<wave>用得着你。</wave>
Chinese (Traditional): 靠近一點。別害怕，雖然你<shake>已經死了，</shake>我還是<wave>用得著你。</wave>
Korean: 가까이 오거라. 두려워 말라, 너는 <shake>이미 죽었건만,</shake> 내 아직 <wave> 너를 필요로 함이라.</wave>
PolskI: Podejdź bliżej. Nie lękaj się, bo choć jesteś <shake>już martwy,</shake> wciąż cię <wave>potrzebuję.</wave>

description:
Speaking: The One Who Waits
  Hinting that this character is death.
English: Those foolish <color=#FFD201>Bishops</color> thought they could keep you from me in death. But instead they sent you <shake>straight to me.</shake>
Japanese: あの愚かな<color=#FFD201>司教ども</color>は、お前を殺せば我と出会うことがないと考えていたようだが…こちらとしてはむしろ<shake>好都合だ。</shake>
Russian: Эти скудоумные <color=#FFD201>епископы</color> думали, что казнь помешает нашей встрече. Однако же они отправили тебя <shake>прямо ко мне</shake>.
French: Ces stupides <color=#FFD201>Prélats</color> pensaient pouvoir t'éloigner de moi, et pourtant, <shake>te voilà.</shake>
German: Diese törichten <color=#FFD201>Bischöfe</color> dachten, sie könnten dich im Tode von mir fernhalten. Stattdessen haben sie dich <shake>direkt zu mir</shake> geschickt.
Spanish: Esos idiotas de los <color=#FFD201>obispos</color> pensaban que matándote podían evitar que llegases a mis manos, pero han conseguido <shake>todo lo contrario</shake>.
Portuguese (Brazil): Aqueles <color=#FFD201>Bispos</color> tolos pensaram que poderiam esconder você de mim na morte. Em vez disso, te enviaram <shake>diretamente para mim</shake>.
Chinese (Simplified): 那些愚蠢的<color=#FFD201>主教</color>以为，你死了我就找不到你。没想到，却是把你<shake>直接送到我眼前。</shake>
Chinese (Traditional): 那些愚蠢的<color=#FFD201>主教</color>以為你死了我就找不到你。沒想到，卻是把你<shake>直接送到我眼前。</shake>
Korean: 저 어리석은 <color=#FFD201>주교</color>들은 죽음으로 나와 너를 가를 수 있다 생각하였다. 허나 이는 너를 내게 <shake>곧바로 보냄이라.</shake>
PolskI: Tamci naiwni <color=#FFD201>Biskupi</color> sądzili, że śmierć cię przede mną ochroni. Lecz wysłali cię <shake>bezpośrednio do mnie.</shake>”

description:
Speaking: The One Who Waits
  Can bring your back to life, but will cost something from you.
English: I will give you <wave>LIFE</wave> again, but at a <shake>PRICE!</shake>
Japanese: お前に<wave>再びの命</wave>をやろう、もちろん<shake>代償</shake>は払ってもらうがな！
Russian: Я верну тебе <wave>жизнь</wave>, но с одним <shake>условием</shake>.
French: Je suis prêt à te redonner la <wave>VIE</wave>, mais la vie a un <shake>PRIX</shake>...
German: Ich schenke dir erneut <wave>LEBEN</wave>, aber das hat seinen <shake>PREIS</shake>!
Spanish: Te devolveré a la <wave>VIDA</wave>, ¡pero aquí todo tiene un <shake>precio</shake>!
Portuguese (Brazil): Devolverei a <wave>VIDA</wave> a você, mas terá um <shake>PREÇO!</shake>
Chinese (Simplified): 我会赐你<wave>新生命</wave>，但你必须付出<shake>代价！</shake>
Chinese (Traditional): 我會賜你<wave>新生命</wave>，但你必須付出<shake>代價！</shake>
Korean: 내 너에게 <wave>생명</wave>을 주나니, 허나 거기에는 <shake>대가</shake>가 따름이라!
PolskI: Dam ci <wave>ŻYCIE</wave> ponownie, ale za pewną <shake>CENĘ!</shake>

description:
Speaking: The One Who Waits
  Says the player needs to start Cult in his name, asking if you accept. Shows options above (Death/Intro/ResponseYes0, Death/Intro/ResponseYes1)
English: All I ask is for you to start a<wave> Cult </wave>in my name. Do we have a deal?
Japanese: 我が名の下に<wave>教団</wave>を始めよ。やってくれるな？
Russian: Ты создашь <wave>религию</wave> в мою честь. Договорились?
French: Tout ce que je te demande, c'est de créer un <wave>culte</wave> en mon nom. Qu'en dis-tu, avons-nous un accord ?
German: Alles, was ich von dir verlange, ist, einen <wave>Kult</wave> in meinem Namen zu gründen. Sind wir im Geschäft?
Spanish: Lo único que te pido a cambio es que fundes una <wave>secta</wave> en mi nombre. ¿Trato?
Portuguese (Brazil): Tudo que peço é que você comece um<wave> Culto </wave>em meu nome. Estamos de acordo?
Chinese (Simplified): 我对你只有一个要求，以我之名创立<wave>圣教</wave>。一言为定？
Chinese (Traditional): 我對你只有一個要求，就是以我之名創立<wave>聖教</wave>。一言為定？
Korean: 내 바라는 것은 오직 하나, 나의 이름을 내세운 <wave>교단</wave>을 만드는 것 뿐이니라. 어떻게 생각하느냐?
PolskI: Jedyne, o co ciebie proszę, to stworzenie <wave>Kultu</wave> w moim imieniu. Zgadzasz się?

description:
